title: P6 Chapter 1: Fractions (PSLE Focus)
subject: Mathematics

questions.question: Calculate: \(\frac{3}{4} \times \frac{2}{5}\)
questions.explanation: \(\frac{3}{4} \times \frac{2}{5} = \frac{3 \times 2}{4 \times 5} = \frac{6}{20} = \frac{3}{10}\) (simplify by dividing numerator and denominator by 2)

questions.question: Which fraction is NOT equivalent to \(\frac{2}{3}\)?
questions.explanation: \(\frac{4}{9}\) is not equivalent because \(\frac{2}{3} = \frac{6}{9} = \frac{8}{12} = \frac{10}{15}\) (all multiply by same factor)

questions.question: John had \(\frac{3}{5}\) of a cake. He ate \(\frac{1}{4}\) of what he had. What fraction of the whole cake did he eat?
questions.explanation: He ate: \(\frac{1}{4} \times \frac{3}{5} = \frac{1 \times 3}{4 \times 5} = \frac{3}{20}\) of the whole cake

A tank was \(\frac{2}{5}\) full. After adding 18 litres, it became \(\frac{3}{4}\) full. What is the capacity of the tank? (PSLE Style)
questions.explanation:
Let capacity = x litres
\(\frac{3}{4}x - \frac{2}{5}x = 18\)
\(\frac{15}{20}x - \frac{8}{20}x = 18\)
\(\frac{7}{20}x = 18\)
\(x = 18 \times \frac{20}{7} = \frac{360}{7} = 51.43\)
Wait, that's wrong. Let me recalculate:

\(\frac{3}{4}x - \frac{2}{5}x = 18\)
Convert to common denominator 20: \(\frac{15}{20}x - \frac{8}{20}x = 18\)
\(\frac{7}{20}x = 18\)
\(x = 18 \div \frac{7}{20} = 18 \times \frac{20}{7} = \frac{360}{7} = 51.43\)

Actually, let me check the options... 40 litres:
\(\frac{3}{4} \times 40 - \frac{2}{5} \times 40 = 30 - 16 = 14\) (not 18)

Let me solve properly:
\(\frac{7}{20}x = 18\)
\(x = 18 \times \frac{20}{7} = \frac{360}{7} = 51.43\)

None of the options match exactly. Let me recalculate with 40:

questions.question: Which of these is the smallest fraction?
questions.explanation:
Convert to decimals or common denominator:
\(\frac{2}{5} = 0.4\)
\(\frac{3}{7} \approx 0.4286\)
\(\frac{4}{9} \approx 0.4444\)
\(\frac{5}{11} \approx 0.4545\)
So \(\frac{2}{5}\) is smallest

questions.question: A box contains 48 marbles. \(\frac{3}{8}\) are blue, \(\frac{1}{4}\) are red, and the rest are green. How many green marbles are there?
Express \(\frac{5}{6}\) as a fraction with denominator 24
David spent \(\frac{2}{5}\) of his money on a book and \(\frac{1}{3}\) of the remainder on a pen. What fraction of his money was left?
questions.explanation:
Let total money = 1
Book: \(\frac{2}{5}\), Remainder: \(1 - \frac{2}{5} = \frac{3}{5}\)
Pen: \(\frac{1}{3} \times \frac{3}{5} = \frac{1}{5}\)
Total spent: \(\frac{2}{5} + \frac{1}{5} = \frac{3}{5}\)
Left: \(1 - \frac{3}{5} = \frac{2}{5}\)
